content:
• Thursday, June 14, 2012
  • IIVI

    II-VI (NASDAQ:IIVI) -7.6% AH after warning it expects FQ4 (ends June 30) revenue of $135M-$137M...

    II-VI (NASDAQ:IIVI) -7.6% AH after warning it expects FQ4 (ends June 30) revenue of $135M-$137M and EPS of $0.23-$0.25, below a consensus of $141.1M and $0.29. It's also guiding for FY13 revenue of $582M-$588M and EPS of $1.14-$1.21, below a consensus of $593M and $1.34. The provider of exotic high-tech materials and high-precision components says it's been hurt by soft demand and pricing for tellurium, and a slowdown for its Marlow thermoelectric cooler business.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:24 PM
  • MVIS

    Microvision (NASDAQ:MVIS) -3.7% AH after announcing a stock offering of undisclosed size. The...

    Microvision (NASDAQ:MVIS) -3.7% AH after announcing a stock offering of undisclosed size. The company only says it intends to use the proceeds for "general corporate purposes." Microvision has been bleeding cash for much of its history, and only had $6.8M on its balance sheet as of March 30. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM | 3 Comments
  • DYAX

    Dyax (NASDAQ:DYAX) -14% AH after declaring it will discontinue its Phase 2 trial for a drug...

    Dyax (NASDAQ:DYAX) -14% AH after declaring it will discontinue its Phase 2 trial for a drug meant to treat angiodema. Dyax says data from 72 patients taking part in the trials failed to produce a "statistically significant" difference in results for those taking its drug relative to those taking a placebo. Nonetheless, the company remains committed to broader angiodema drug development.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • QCOM

    Qualcomm (QCOM -3.7%) and Skyworks (SWKS -3.4%) end up on the list of names (previous) dinged by...

    Qualcomm (QCOM -3.7%) and Skyworks (SWKS -3.4%) end up on the list of names (previous) dinged by Nokia's warning. Qualcomm's decline, which likely relates to its status as the top chip supplier for Nokia's Lumia phones, comes even though Wedge Partners' Brian Blair is defending the company against fears Samsung's (OTC:SSNLF) phone sales are weakening. Blair thinks the Galaxy S III is propping up Samsung, and argues FY12 estimates for Qualcomm are too low.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 7 Comments
  • PBR

    The latest investment plan from Petrobras (PBR -2.5%) confirms a worrying trend, Liam Denning...

    The latest investment plan from Petrobras (PBR -2.5%) confirms a worrying trend, Liam Denning writes: Planned $236.5B in spending during 2012-2016 is up 5% from last year's plan, while projected 2020 output of 5.7M bbl/day implies more than double its current output - which has stagnated since late 2010. Brazil is always the country of tomorrow, and PBR continues to suffer in the same way.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • MPAA

    Motorcar Parts (MPAA -3.9%) announces that it will delay the release of its FY12 year-end...

    Motorcar Parts (MPAA -3.9%) announces that it will delay the release of its FY12 year-end results to June 29. The company says that recent acquisitions held up the processing of its financials.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • MJN

    Mead Johnson (MJN +3.5%) trades higher after Credit Suisse raises its earnings estimates due to...

    Mead Johnson (MJN +3.5%) trades higher after Credit Suisse raises its earnings estimates due to lower commodity prices in China. Shares could also be getting kick from a report that rival Yili has started recalling milk powder produced over a six month period due to an excessive mercury count.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM
  • HUN

    Huntsman (HUN +5.4%) shares spike higher on a Reuters report that Bank of America has reached...

    Huntsman (HUN +5.4%) shares spike higher on a Reuters report that Bank of America has reached out to several PE firms regarding interest in a potential deal for the chemical company.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • CE

    Chemicals maker Celanese (CE -1.3%) says huge new supplies of U.S. natural gas will enable it to...

    Chemicals maker Celanese (CE -1.3%) says huge new supplies of U.S. natural gas will enable it to build a new methanol production plant in Texas. The facility, to be built near at its Clear Lake acetyl complex, will have a capacity of 1.3M metric tons/year and is expected to start operations after July 1, 2015. The cost of the new plant is not disclosed.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • HD

    Shares of Home Depot (HD +2.1%) and Lowe's (LOW +3.1%) trade higher as the pair of stocks...

    Shares of Home Depot (HD +2.1%) and Lowe's (LOW +3.1%) trade higher as the pair of stocks benefit from a mix of improving housing trends and the notion that Fed easing back is on the table.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • OSIR

    Osiris Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OSIR) +10.7% after it receives approval to market its stem cell...

    Osiris Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OSIR) +10.7% after it receives approval to market its stem cell therapy Prochymal in New Zealand for treating graft-vs-host disease ((GvHD)) in children, adding to Canadian approval last month. Prochymal is the first therapy approved for GvHD, which occurs when immune cells in transplanted bone marrow attack the recipient's body cells.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • SUNEQ

    MEMC (WFR +5.9%) bounces after receiving a $3.68M manufacturing grant from the DOE. The company...

    MEMC (WFR +5.9%) bounces after receiving a $3.68M manufacturing grant from the DOE. The company has posted huge losses over the last two quarters, and seen its shares lose about 2/3 of their value since late January.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM
  • LPSN

    LivePerson (LPSN +3.5%) rallies after receiving positive notes from Roth and Oppenheimer. The...

    LivePerson (LPSN +3.5%) rallies after receiving positive notes from Roth and Oppenheimer. The former sees new products boosting revenue growth, while the latter says checks at LivePerson's just-finished Aspire conference indicate growing interest in the company's data intelligence products for customer interactions on a web site. On Tuesday, LivePerson announced it's buying mobile app customer support software vendor Look.io.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • SVU

    Shares of Supervalu (SVU +7.1%) shoot up on heavy volume as M&A chatter continues to swirl...

    Shares of Supervalu (SVU +7.1%) shoot up on heavy volume as M&A chatter continues to swirl about. The grocery store operator is catching up to rivals with its private-label products and boasts a free cash flow yield of 45% - more than 10X times the average mark for U.S. food retailers.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • AOL

    AOL's (AOL -7.6%) losses accelerate following its thwarting of Starboard Value's efforts to win...

    AOL's (AOL -7.6%) losses accelerate following its thwarting of Starboard Value's efforts to win five board seats. Investors had bid up AOL shares this year partly on hopes Starboard would succeed in forcing AOL to curtail the losses posted by its online media division, a major point of contention for the activist fund. Instead of new board members, shareholders attending AOL's annual meeting saw a spirited defense of the company's money-losing Patch local news unit.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR -2.2%) plans to boost its investments over five years to $236.5B, a 5% increase...

    Petrobras (PBR -2.2%) plans to boost its investments over five years to $236.5B, a 5% increase from its previous investment plan, with 60% spent on exploration and production as Brazil's state oil company aims to "recover the production curve for oil and natural gas." PBR targets 5.7M bbl/day of oil and gas production worldwide by 2020, 91% from Brazil.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 2 Comments
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -4.5%) tilt lower after channel checks from...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -4.5%) tilt lower after channel checks from Detwiler Fenton indicate that sales of K-Cups slowed in May. The report doesn't include sales from Starbucks outlets, which just started selling K-Cups this week.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 8 Comments
  • Z

    Zillow (Z +5.8%) jumps on an upgrade to Outperform from Pac Crest. A full 50.1% of the company's...

    Zillow (Z +5.8%) jumps on an upgrade to Outperform from Pac Crest. A full 50.1% of the company's float was shorted as of May 31, but Steven Cohen's SAC Capital has been a buyer.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • APA

    "This is the time to drill more wells: We have captured a vast, liquids-rich resource base and...

    "This is the time to drill more wells: We have captured a vast, liquids-rich resource base and drilling costs are declining," Apache (APA +3.5%) CEO Steven Farris exults, as APA's new resource inventory estimates 9.2B net boe and 67K drillable locations in the Permian and Anadarko basins. New prospects include 880K net acres in Kansas, Nebraska and Montana holding ~3B bbl of crude.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • NOK

    In the wake of its latest warning and restructuring plan, Nokia (NOK -17.6%) says it's willing...

    In the wake of its latest warning and restructuring plan, Nokia (NOK -17.6%) says it's willing to sell part of its patent portfolio to help raise cash. The portfolio, which has allowed Nokia to collect royalties from Apple, contains 30K patents, including a number of innovations critical to 3G/4G networks and smartphone user interfaces. Also: Nokia says it's acquiring Scalado, a Swedish developer of imaging technologies that are used in over 1B devices. (more on NOK)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 10 Comments
  • RDS.A

    Starting up new capacity at a refinery sometimes leads to shutdowns, but early reports of the...

    Starting up new capacity at a refinery sometimes leads to shutdowns, but early reports of the severity of the mechanical failure at the huge Motiva refinery (RDS.A, RDS.B) indicate the breakdown might be especially burdensome, taking months to repair. Several refinery stocks rise: WNR +3.3%, VLO +1.7%, COP +0.4%, TSO +0.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM | 7 Comments
  • LSCC

    Lattice Semiconductor (NASDAQ:LSCC) plummets 16.3% after an earnings warning in which it...

    Lattice Semiconductor (NASDAQ:LSCC) plummets 16.3% after an earnings warning in which it forecasts that Q2 revenue will be flat to -4% Q/Q, indicating sales of $69.5M-$71.7M. That's below consensus of $73.5M; the prior guidance had been flat to +4%. Lattice, which is suffering from a soft EU market, also cuts its gross margin forecast to 51% from 55%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • EW

    Edwards Lifesciences (NYSE:EW) +6.5% following news that an FDA advisory panel voted almost...

    Edwards Lifesciences (NYSE:EW) +6.5% following news that an FDA advisory panel voted almost unanimously to recommend the expanded use of the company's Sapien artificial heart valve as an alternative to open heart surgery. The panel did have caveats, though, including an increased risk of stroke. The FDA may make a decision in October.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -3.7%) sells off towards its post-IPO lows after Ascendant Capital slashes its...

    Groupon (GRPN -3.7%) sells off towards its post-IPO lows after Ascendant Capital slashes its 2012 EPS estimate and lowers its PT to $8. The firm is worried about forex issues (i.e. a weak euro), and also airs concerns about higher refund reserves, an issue that took center stage in the company's Q4 restatement.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • XOM

    Natural gas (UNG +6.4%) prices surge after the EIA reports U.S. natural gas stocks rose by 67B...

    Natural gas (UNG +6.4%) prices surge after the EIA reports U.S. natural gas stocks rose by 67B cubic ft., below the 71B-75B cubic ft. increase analysts had expected. Working stocks of natural gas totaled 2.94T cubic ft., up 708B cubic ft. Y/Y and 666B cubic ft. higher than the five-year average. XOM +0.7%, CHK +1.5%, EOG +1.5%, SWN +1.6%, COG +2.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM | 3 Comments
  • PIR

    Specialty home furnishing companies are trading higher as they ride the coattails of Pier 1...

    Specialty home furnishing companies are trading higher as they ride the coattails of Pier 1 Imports' strong same-store sales numbers and hiked FY12 guidance. (PIR +5.3%). So far this year, consumers haven't backed off in droves after seeing price increases on home accessories. Gainers: KIRK +4.9%, HVT +3.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • SDRL

    Shipping tycoon John Fredriksen is set to raise his stake in Seadrill (SDRL +2%), after selling...

    Shipping tycoon John Fredriksen is set to raise his stake in Seadrill (SDRL +2%), after selling shares earlier this year, as the rig contractor’s share price has slumped in recent months. Fredriksen will exercise a put option to buy back up to 6M shares from Goldman Sachs, or a quarter of the 24M shares it sold for more than $1B earlier this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 2 Comments
  • P

    Pandora (P +2.4%) trades higher on an upgrade to Overweight from Albert Fried on valuation...

    Pandora (P +2.4%) trades higher on an upgrade to Overweight from Albert Fried on valuation grounds. While noting it had a lot of concerns about Pandora when launching coverage last summer, the firm thinks recent fears related to the emergence of playlist-streaming app Songza create a buying opportunity.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM | 2 Comments
  • FDO

    Shares of a number of discount retailers are trading higher as investors digest recent retail...

    Shares of a number of discount retailers are trading higher as investors digest recent retail sales trends and economic releases to bet that shoppers will continue to trade down. Advancers: FDO +4.9%, DG +1.1%, FRED +3.3%, COST +2.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM -5%) slumps in the wake of Nokia's (NOK -14.7%) warning, as investors...

    Research In Motion (RIMM -5%) slumps in the wake of Nokia's (NOK -14.7%) warning, as investors decide what's bad for Symbian is also bad for BlackBerry. The decline comes as RIM adds TPG Capital partner/former Goldman exec Timothy Dattels to its board. RF Micro Devices (RFMD -2.8%), a major power amplifier supplier to Nokia, is also selling off.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM | 2 Comments
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA +2.7%) rallies a bit after Morgan Stanley joins a slew of firms defending the...

    Zynga (ZNGA +2.7%) rallies a bit after Morgan Stanley joins a slew of firms defending the company on account of its huge selloff. Like others, MS sees new game releases and the end of Zynga's IPO lockup expirations giving shares a lift. 35% of Zynga's float was shorted as of May 31.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 4 Comments
  • JIVE

    Jive Software (JIVE +9.2%) jumps following reports Microsoft (MSFT -0.7%) is in talks to buy...

    Jive Software (JIVE +9.2%) jumps following reports Microsoft (MSFT -0.7%) is in talks to buy Jive rival Yammer, potentially for $1B+. AllThingsD's Arik Hesseldahl suggests Yammer's lack of IPO preparation (unlike Jive) and challenges in getting users to pay make a Microsoft deal logical. ZDNet's Eileen Brown notes Yammer is used by 85% of the Fortune 500, and could bolster Microsoft's efforts to add cloud and social networking features to its Dynamics business apps.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • NVLN

    Aegerion Pharmaceuticals (AEGR -10.1%) says it plans a public offering of 3.4M shares of common...

    Aegerion Pharmaceuticals (AEGR -10.1%) says it plans a public offering of 3.4M shares of common stock at $14.75/share, as it looks to raise funds for activities related to the regulatory approval and commercialization of its lipid disorder treatment and lead product candidate lomitapide.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • AOL

    AOL (AOL -3.4%) overcomes a challenge from dissident investor Starboard as shareholders re-elect...

    AOL (AOL -3.4%) overcomes a challenge from dissident investor Starboard as shareholders re-elect all eight of the firm's existing directors, preliminary results show. AOL says it will continue its "plans to pursue adding two new independent directors to the Board." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • GMO

    General Moly (NYSEMKT:GMO) +10.3% premarket on news that a Nevada State District Court affirmed...

    General Moly (NYSEMKT:GMO) +10.3% premarket on news that a Nevada State District Court affirmed the Nevada State Engineer's approval of water rights for the Mt. Hope molybdenum mine and issuance of Mt. Hope water permits.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM
  • DDD

    Shares of 3D Systems (NYSE:DDD) fall off 6.8% premarket after its $100M stock offering is priced...

    Shares of 3D Systems (NYSE:DDD) fall off 6.8% premarket after its $100M stock offering is priced at $27 a share.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: Stock futures enjoy a bit of a rollercoaster following poor jobless claims and...

    Market preview: Stock futures enjoy a bit of a rollercoaster following poor jobless claims and lower-than expected CPI, falling sharply before recovering. The S&P Benchmark is +0.2%. Spanish 10-year yields are nearing 7%, but while most EU shares are down, Madrid is higher. Oil is flat ahead of OPEC. Nokia is -11.5% following another profit warning.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • QSFT

    More on Quest Software's buyout offer: The offer, said to come from a "strategic bidder," comes...

    More on Quest Software's buyout offer: The offer, said to come from a "strategic bidder," comes nearly two weeks after it was reported talks with Dell broke down. Quest adds the terms of a merger agreement "have been fully negotiated," but notes Insight Venture is said to maintain "certain matching rights" related to its offer. QSFT +8.4%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • NBGGY

    Premarket gainers: NBG +21%. QSFT +9%. IGT +6%. Losers: AEGR -10%. CS -9%. NOK -9%. DDD -6%.

    Premarket gainers: NBG +21%. QSFT +9%. IGT +6%.
    Losers: AEGR -10%. CS -9%. NOK -9%. DDD -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • QSFT

    Quest Software (NASDAQ:QSFT) +8.2% to $25.81 after it receives a buyout offer of $25.50 a share....

    Quest Software (NASDAQ:QSFT) +8.2% to $25.81 after it receives a buyout offer of $25.50 a share. That's above yesterday's close of $23.81 and is a "superior proposal" to Insight Venture's bid of $23. (previous) (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM | 1 Comment
  • BBY

    Citi upgrades Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) to Neutral from Sell based on valuation with shares getting...

    Citi upgrades Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) to Neutral from Sell based on valuation with shares getting thrashed around on headlines stories. Analysts call a leveraged buyout of Best Buy "highly unlikely" due to the large size of a potential deal and the headaches created by the raw square footage of the retailer's properties. Shares +1.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM
  • KR

    Kroger (NYSE:KR): Q1 EPS of $0.78 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $29.1B (+5.8% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    Kroger (NYSE:KR): Q1 EPS of $0.78 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $29.1B (+5.8% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +4.3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM
  • JASO

    JA Solar (NASDAQ:JASO) +18.3% premarket after announcing a $100M share repurchase program...

    JA Solar (NASDAQ:JASO) +18.3% premarket after announcing a $100M share repurchase program effective immediately.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM
  • IGT

    International Game Technology (NYSE:IGT) +7.4% premarket after announcing authorization of a new...

    International Game Technology (NYSE:IGT) +7.4% premarket after announcing authorization of a new $1B share repurchase program and a $400M accelerated stock buyback agreement with Goldman Sachs.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM
  • SFD

    More on Smithfield Foods (NYSE:SFD) FQ4: Net profit slips to $79.5M from $98.4M, dragged lower...

    More on Smithfield Foods (NYSE:SFD) FQ4: Net profit slips to $79.5M from $98.4M, dragged lower by falling margins at its fresh pork ops due to high feed costs, while pork supplies rose and retail demand was softer than expected. Smithfield plans to repurchase an extra $250M of stock over the next two years. Shares -5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM
  • CS

    Credit Suisse plunges 7.9% premarket as the SNB tells the bank to improve its capital position -...

    Credit Suisse plunges 7.9% premarket as the SNB tells the bank to improve its capital position - by suspending dividends or issuing shares - to better absorb losses from the EMU crisis. The central bank notes leverage remains "very high" at both CS and UBS, and both should trim their balance sheets.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:26 AM | 2 Comments
  • SFD

    Smithfield Foods (NYSE:SFD): FQ4 EPS of $0.43 misses by $0.11. Revenue of $3.2B (+3% Y/Y) misses...

    Smithfield Foods (NYSE:SFD): FQ4 EPS of $0.43 misses by $0.11. Revenue of $3.2B (+3% Y/Y) misses by $70M. Shares -4.3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:31 AM
  • NOK

    Nokia's (NYSE:NOK) bleeding, now -10.4% premarket after its all-out attempt this morning to...

    Nokia's (NYSE:NOK) bleeding, now -10.4% premarket after its all-out attempt this morning to return to profitability by slashing jobs and shuffling management. And selling its Vertu luxury handset business. And promising to consider the sale of other non-core assets. The job-cut count by Stephen Elop, who became CEO less than two years ago, now stands at just under 40,000.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:55 AM | 20 Comments
  • NOK

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) -5.7% in Milan trading after cutting its Q2 outlook, reshuffling management and...

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) -5.7% in Milan trading after cutting its Q2 outlook, reshuffling management and announcing plans to slash 10,000 jobs and shutter some facilities. Stay tuned for some ugly U.S. premarket trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 AM | 2 Comments
